content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the fact that certain informations are only provided by the tests, making the program just a little bit more complicated than it looks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The problem feels like it's of an appropriate difficulty for a reverse mode challenge. Additionally it has a test case to cover non-alphabetical characters which was a nice touch in illuminating the expected behavior.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting task, was solved quickly enough.
The only thing is that I think you have to clear the Goal section out of redundant information.

I don't think it's a good idea to have Fastest and Shortest modes work the same way as Reverse mode.

Fastest Mode should be for players to read the requirements (if they want to) and code as quickly as possible. Shortest Mode should be for players to read the requirements (if they want to) and write the shortest code possible. I don't think it's a good idea to force the players to spend time on guessing the requirement in these two modes (if they VOLUNTARILY want to skip reading the statement and guess the requirement, it's fine).

Thanks.
Done … I changed to just Reverse mode
It's not shown during a Reverse mode clash, so it doesn't matter much.
